abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Structural Adjustment Loan
            Project supports the government's structural adjustment
            program designed to: lay the analytical framework for an
            extensive public sector modernization; consolidate and
            deepen reforms supported by the first loan in tax reform,
            privatization, trade, financial and social sector reforms,
            and poverty alleviation; and promote actions to strengthen
            public expenditure, civil service, environmental management,
            and restructuring the hydrocarbon sector. Political and
            economic accomplishments over the past two years have left
            El Salvador poised for sustained social and economic
            development and equitable growth. The Bank's strategy
            is to support the government in meeting its development
            challenges through a blend of adjustment lending, investment
            lending in selected sectors, analytical work to address
            sectoral issues and guide the policy dialogue, technical
            assistance to deepen reforms and strengthen institutions,
            and donor coordination. Progress on implementation of the
            Bank's assistance strategy will be judged on four
            criteria: maintenance of an appropriate macroeconomic
            framework; successful implementation of the reform program
            supported by this loan; government willingness and ability
            to carry out a comprehensive public sector reform program;
            and continued government commitment to poverty alleviation
            and improved environmental management.
